Distinct criticism on Guttenberg's crisis management was passed by [[Norbert Lammert]], [[President of the Bundestag|President of the German Bundestag]]. In an interview on 22 February 2013, Lammert also expressed his doubts about the reliability of the university's awarding process.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wdr.de/unternehmen/presselounge/pressemitteilungen/2011/02/20110222_eins_zu_eins.phtml|title=Bundestagspräsident Lammert kritisiert Krisenmanagement zu Guttenbergs|date=22 February 2011|publisher=WDR|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
===Loss of doctorate=== ====Parliamentary questioning==== The following day Lammert presided over a parliamentary questioning in the Bundestag on Guttenberg's use of PRS papers in his thesis.<ref name=" Political Allies Blast Guttenberg: Support Wanes Fast for German Defense Minister " /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dip21.bundestag.de/dip21/btp/17/17092.pdf|title=Plenarprotokoll 17/32|date=23 February 2011|publisher=Deutscher Bundestag|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> During the questioning politicians from the opposition called for Guttenberg's resignation”<ref name="German minister in plagiarism row stripped of PhD" /> and accused him of cheating, lying and intentions to deceive.<ref name="German defense minister loses doctorate amid plagiarism scandal" /> In his reply Guttenberg again apologized and admitted: “I wrote a dissertation that was obviously flawed”.<ref name="German minister in plagiarism row stripped of PhD" /> He described himself as “a man of mistakes and weaknesses”<ref name="Merkel’s Defense Minister Stripped of University Doctor Title">{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-23/merkel-s-defense-minister-stripped-of-university-doctor-title.html|title=Merkel’s Defense Minister Stripped of University Doctor Title|date=23 February 2011|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> and stated “I did not deliberately cheat, but made serious errors”.<ref name="German defence minister stripped of doctorate for plagiarism">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/feb/24/german-defence-minister-guttenberg-plagiarism|title=German defence minister stripped of doctorate for plagiarism|date=24 February 2011|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg declared: “I was certainly so arrogant as to believe that I could square the circle by trying to coordinate political passion and work, as well as academic and intellectual challenges, with being a young father” and apologized “for me this was overload, and today I regret to say that I couldn’t manage it.”<ref name="Merkel’s Defense Minister Stripped of University Doctor Title" /> Asked whether his call for the allegations as “abstruse” hadn’t been premature, Guttenberg confirmed this part of his previous statement as it was related to the accusation of his thesis as being a plagiarism.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/fragestunde-im-bundestag-doktor-guttenberg-und-die-quadratur-des-kreises-1.1064179|title=Guttenbergs Quadratur des Kreises|date=24 February 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/guttenberg-im-bundestag-ich-war-offensichtlich-ueberfordert-a-747280.html|title=Guttenberg im Bundestag: "Ich war offensichtlich überfordert"|date=23 February 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> According to accusations of misusing the German Parliamentary Research Service (PRS) Guttenberg pointed out, that all studies had been related to his political work.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-02/guttenberg-doktorarbeit-bundestag|title=Guttenberg verwahrt sich gegen Täuschungsvorwurf|date=23 February 2011|publisher=ZEIT ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> He noted that all papers had been cited, but without the authors’ names, as they had been employers of the PRS. Guttenberg stated, that he couldn’t answer whether he had sought prior approval to use these reports for his thesis but that he had already apologized to Bundestag's President Lammert in case of a potential oversight.<ref name="n24.de"/>
====University revoked title==== On the same day the doctoral commission of Bayreuth University revoked Guttenberg's PhD.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/chrono.pdf |title=Universität Bayreuth erkennt zu Guttenberg den Doktorgrad ab| language=German | publisher=Universität Bayreuth| format=PDF |date=2011-02-23 |accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/2.1673/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-uni-bayreuth-erkennt-den-doktortitel-ab-1597705.html|title=Uni Bayreuth erkennt den Doktortitel ab|date=24 February 2011|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> University's president [[Rüdiger Bormann]] declared, that Guttenberg had “objectively not conformed” to academic standards.<ref name="Defensive Minister: University Withdraws Guttenberg's Doctor Title">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/defensive-minister-university-withdraws-guttenberg-s-doctor-title-a-747402.html|title=Defensive Minister: University Withdraws Guttenberg's Doctor Title|date=24 February 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE International|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> According to Bormann this fast revocation was possible because of Guttenberg's statement.<ref name="German defence minister stripped of doctorate for plagiarism" /><ref name="Die Universität Bayreuth kneift">{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/guttenberg-verliert-doktortitel-reaktionen-die-universitaet-bayreuth-kneift-1.1064265|title=Die Universität Bayreuth kneift|date=24 February 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The doctoral commission made no judgment as to whether Guttenberg had acted intentionally,<ref name="Defensive Minister: University Withdraws Guttenberg's Doctor Title" /> something that led to criticism.<ref name="Die Universität Bayreuth kneift" /><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article12631117/Die-Uni-Bayreuth-kneift-kritisiert-die-SPD.html|title="Die Uni Bayreuth kneift" – kritisiert die SPD|date=24 February 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Such an investigation would “surely have been an extended process”, Bormann declared, which was unnecessary after Guttenberg's request for a withdrawal of his title.<ref name="Defensive Minister: University Withdraws Guttenberg's Doctor Title" /> Further inquiries would be done by the Commission of Professional Self Conduct in Science, Bormann announced.<ref name="Die Universität Bayreuth kneift" /><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article12635417/Uni-Bayreuth-ueberprueft-moeglichen-Taeuschungsvorsatz.html|title=Uni Bayreuth überprüft möglichen Täuschungsvorsatz|date=24 February 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Chancellor Merkel commented on the revocation of Guttenberg's title as being “in line of what he had requested”.<ref name="Merkel’s Defense Minister Stripped of University Doctor Title" />
====Further investigations==== On 24 February 2011, [[Bundestagspräsident]] [[Norbert Lammert]] declared that Guttenberg had used six reports by the parliament's research service for his doctoral thesis without prior approval.<ref name=certifiable>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/verteidigungsminister-plagiatsvorwuerfe-guttenberg-bediente-sich-bei-sechs-bundestags-expertisen-1.1064636|title=Guttenberg bediente sich bei sechs Bundestags-Expertisen|language=German|publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-02-24|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,747577,00.html|title=Guttenberg verwendete Bundestags-Expertisen ohne Erlaubnis|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-02-24|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> However, Lammert acknowledged the fact that it was widespread practice among Bundestag Members to use documents prepared by the parliamentary research service without first obtaining the necessary approval.<ref name=certifiable /> The same day, an [[open letter]] to chancellor Merkel was published to be signed by doctoral students and researchers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/offener-brief-verhoehnung-aller-wissenschaftlichen-hilfskraefte-a-747702.html|title=Offener Brief: "Verhöhnung aller wissenschaftlichen Hilfskräfte"|date=25 February 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2015}}</ref> The successor of Guttenberg's thesis supervisor Häberle at the University of Bayreuth, [[Oliver Lepsius]], alleged that the minister made the mistakes deliberately and accused him of fraud.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/2.1673/plagiats-affaere-wir-sind-einem-betrueger-aufgesessen-1592871.html|title=Wir sind einem Betrüger aufgesessen|date=25 February 2011|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
Media reported that between 1999 and 2006 a new chair of the University of Bayreuth had been sponsored with €747.000 by [[Rhön-Klinikum]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/politik/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-750-000-euro-fuer-die-uni-bayreuth/3879402.html|title=750.000 Euro für die Uni Bayreuth|date=25 February 2011|publisher=DER TAGESSPIEGEL|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Until 2002 Guttenberg's family held a major stake in the hospital and he had been a member of its [[supervisory board]]. In a statement the university denied any sponsoring by Guttenberg as the funding had been part of cooperation between the university, a health insurance, the state of Bavaria and Rhön-Klinikum.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/chrono.pdf |title=Kooperation mit Rhön-Klinikum AG im Bereich Gesundheitsökonomie| language=German | publisher=Universität Bayreuth| format=PDF |date=2011-02-25 |accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref>
Two days later, minister Schavan in an interview<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/anette-schavan-ueber-guttenberg-ich-schaeme-mich-nicht-nur-heimlich-1.1065529|title=Ich schäme mich nicht nur heimlich|date=1 March 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> criticized Guttenberg for his thesis: “As someone who earned my doctorate 31 years ago and has worked with many doctoral candidates during my career, I’m embarrassed, and not just privately.”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.de/politics/20110228-33403.html|title=Schavan 'embarrassed' by Guttenberg|date=28 February 2011|publisher=The Local|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/guttenberg-affaere-schavan-plagiatsaffaere-ist-keine-lappalie-1.1065495|title=Schavan: Plagiatsaffäre ist keine Lappalie|date=27 February 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Bundestag's president Lammert called the affair a “nail in the coffin for trust in our democracy”.<ref name=" Political Allies Blast Guttenberg: Support Wanes Fast for German Defense Minister " />
Chancellor Merkel announced through her spokesman Steffen Seibert on 28 February 2011 that Guttenberg had still her full confidence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/trotz-plagiatsaffaere-merkel-bekraeftigt-ihr-vertrauen-zu-guttenberg-1658642.html|title=Merkel bekräftigt ihr Vertrauen zu Guttenberg|date=28 February 2011|publisher=stern.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Asked for Merkel's opinion on the fraud accusation by Oliver Lepsius, Seibert declared, that “fraud requires intention. Any intention was denied by Guttenberg. The Chancellor believes him.”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.taz.de/1/archiv/digitaz/artikel/?ressort=a1&dig=2011%2F03%2F01%2Fa0031&cHash=67f9f3d9fc3c805eda54a10f1db5cfca|title=Doktoranden gegen Dr. Merkel|date=1 March 2013|publisher=taz|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aargauerzeitung.ch/ausland/merkel-haelt-weiter-zu-guttenberg-aber-kritik-aus-der-koalition-105276236|title=Merkel hält weiter zu Guttenberg - Aber Kritik aus Koalition|date=28 February 2011|publisher=Aargauer Zeitung|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg himself gained strong support at a CSU-meeting in Munich, while several CSU-politicians sharply criticized Lammert and Schavan on their comments.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/aktuell/article12662535/CSU-stuetzt-Guttenberg-Seehofer-kritisiert-Lammert.html|title=CSU stützt Guttenberg – Seehofer kritisiert Lammert|date=28 February 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/schelte-fuer-schavan-und-lammert-seehofer-watscht-guttenberg-kritiker-ab-1659683.html|title=Seehofer watscht Guttenberg-Kritiker ab|date=3 March 2011|publisher=stern.de|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
===Resignation as Defense Minister=== On 1 March 2011 Guttenberg declared his resignation from all political offices at national level.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/guttenbergs-erklaerung-ich-habe-die-grenzen-meiner-kraefte-erreicht-a-748372.html|title=Guttenbergs Erklärung: "Ich habe die Grenzen meiner Kräfte erreicht"|date=2011-03-02|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/8354285/German-minister-resigns-amid-plagiarism-scandal.html|title=German minister resigns amid plagiarism scandal|date=1 March 2011|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref name="German Defence Minister Guttenberg resigns over thesis">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-12608083|title=German Defence Minister Guttenberg resigns over thesis|date=1 March 2011|publisher=BBC NEWS|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> He called this decision the “most painful step of my life” and declared "I was always ready to fight, but I have reached the limits of my strength".<ref name="German defence minister resigns in plagiarism scandal">{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-germany-resign-20110302,0,3829961.story|title=German defence minister resigns in plagiarism scandal| publisher=Los Angeles Times| date=2011-03-02|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref> "I must agree with my enemies who say that I was not appointed minister for self-defence, but defence-minister" Guttenberg said in view of his ministerial office. As for the enquiry regarding his thesis he announced his full cooperation with the district attorney's investigations.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/guttenberg762.html|title=Minister Guttenberg erklärt seinen Rücktritt|language=German|publisher=tagesschau.de|date=2011-03-01|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref> Guttenberg thanked Angela Merkel for her support, trust and understanding.<ref name="German Defence Minister Guttenberg resigns over thesis" />
Chancellor Merkel reacted to Guttenberg's decision by saying that “I deeply regret his resignation”.<ref name="German defence minister resigns in plagiarism scandal" /> For Merkel he had “a unique and extraordinary ability” relating to people. For the future the Chancellor declared that "I am convinced that we will have the opportunity to work together again in the future, in whatever form that may take".<ref name="German Defence Minister Guttenberg resigns over thesis" />
Rüdiger Bormann, president of University of Bayreuth, declared, that the inquiries of its Commission on Professional Self Regulation in Science would continue.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/chrono.pdf |title=Der Präsident der Universität Bayreuth, Professor Dr. Rüdiger Bormann, zum Rücktritt von Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg| language=German | publisher=Universität Bayreuth| format=PDF |date=2011-02-25 |accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref>
===Apology=== On 2 March 2011 the district attorney's office in Hof announced the launch of an investigation into potential copyright violations contained in Guttenberg's thesis as soon as his [[Parliamentary immunity|immunity]] would be withdrawn.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.justiz.bayern.de/sta/sta/ho/presse/archiv/2011/02949/|title=Strafanzeigen betreffend Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg|date=2 March 2011|publisher=Staatsanwaltschaft Hof|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> With his official resignation as [[Member of Parliament]] the following day,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bundestag.de/bundestag/abgeordnete17/ausgeschiedene/index.html|title=Ausgeschiedene Abgeordnete und deren Nachfolger|publisher=Deutscher Bundestag|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg abandoned his parliamentary immunity, thus allowing the district attorney's investigations to proceed. Media reported on more than 80 charges, which had been filed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/mehr-als-80-anzeigen-gegen-guttenberg-betrug-untreue-urheberrechtsverstoesse-a-748940.html|title=Mehr als 80 Anzeigen gegen Guttenberg: Betrug, Untreue, Urheberrechtsverstöße|date=3 March 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> On 3 March 2011 Guttenberg received his dismissal certificate in a ceremony hosted by [[President of Germany|German President]] [[Christian Wulff]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.n-tv.de/politik/Ermittlungen-gegen-Guttenberg-article2754991.html|title=Ermittlungen gegen Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=n-tv|date=2011-03-03|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref>
The same day, media reported about an anonymous member of the Commission of Professional Self Regulation in Science allegedly accusing Guttenberg of deception.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-staatsanwalt-ermittelt-gegen-guttenberg-1659478.html|title=Staatsanwalt ermittelt gegen Guttenberg|date=3 March 2011|publisher=stern.de|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> In contrast, [[Volker Rieble]], law professor at [[Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich]], himself a strong critic of Guttenberg's thesis,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/aberkannter-doktortitel-guttenbergs-uni-im-visier-der-kritik-1657494.html|title=Guttenbergs Uni im Visier der Kritik|date=25 February 2011|publisher=stern.|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> published an op-ed disputing the legal basis for further investigations in view of the fact that the university had already revoked Guttenberg's title and that he was no longer affiliated with the university.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/artikel/C32372/guttenbergs-plagiataffaere-bayreuth-fehlt-legitimation-zur-pruefung-30329397.html|title=Bayreuth fehlt Legitimation zur Prüfung|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|date=2011-03-03|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref>
On March 5, 2011, the thesis supervisors Peter Häberle and Rudolf Streinz issued a statement declaring that in 2006, when the thesis was finished, the plagiarism wasn’t detectable for lack of technical opportunities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/2.1673/guttenbergs-doktorvater-plagiat-war-2006-noch-nicht-erkennbar-1612183.html|title=Plagiat war 2006 noch nicht erkennbar|date=7 March 2011|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> Without knowledge of the copied passages, Guttenberg's thesis demonstrated “a high degree of analytical depths and penetrated the dissertation topic in all its facets”, Häberle emphasized.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/guttenbergs-doktorvater-plagiat-war-noch-nicht-erkennbar-1.1068885|title=Plagiat war 2006 noch nicht erkennbar|date=7 March 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> “It is important to note that the candidate [Guttenberg] was able to respond successfully to even intense questioning regarding the methodology and content of the thesis and was completely able to hold his own during the discussion as part of the oral PhD exam”,<ref name="Staatsanwaltschaft ermittelt gegen Guttenberg">{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-03/guttenberg-staatsanwaltschaft-ermittlung|title=Staatsanwaltschaft ermittelt gegen Guttenberg|date=7 March 2013|publisher=ZEIT ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> the supervisors declared on Guttenberg's doctoral examination procedure and its grading (summa cum laude).<ref name="Universität Bayreuth">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|pages=9–10|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
On 7 March 2011 the district attorney's office in Hof announced the launch of a preliminary investigation into potential copyright violations by Guttenberg.<ref name="Staatsanwaltschaft ermittelt gegen Guttenberg" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-staatsanwalt-leitet-ermittlungen-gegen-guttenberg-ein-a-749452.html|title=Plagiatsaffäre: Staatsanwalt leitet Ermittlungen gegen Guttenberg ein|date=7 March 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsvorwuerfe-staatsanwalt-ermittelt-gegen-guttenberg-1660910.html|title=Staatsanwalt ermittelt gegen Guttenberg|date=7 March 2013|publisher=stern.de|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> The University of Bayreuth, on 8 March 2011, announced the expansion of the commission investigating Guttenberg's dissertation to also include [[Wolfgang Löwer]], professor of law at [[University of Bonn]], and [[Jürgen Mittelstraß]], professor of philosophy at [[University of Konstanz]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/0,1518,750355,00.html|title=Uni entscheidet erst im April|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-03-11|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref>
A few days later, as a means of taking responsibility for his error, Guttenberg sent personal apology letters to all those authors who were not properly quoted in his thesis.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/bundestagswissenschaftler-guttenberg-bittet-persoenlich-um-entschuldigung_aid_607801.html|title=Guttenberg bittet persönlich um Entschuldigung|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2011-03-12|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/vorab/0,1518,750513,00.html|title=Guttenberg entschuldigt sich bei Wissenschaftlern|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-03-12|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> Guttenberg resigned from his last political office, the [[Kulmbach]] county council, on 15 March 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,757318,00.html|title=Guttenberg legt Kreistagsmandat nieder|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-04-15|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref> At the same day the open letter, signed by 63,713 people, was delivered to the [[German Chancellery|Chancellery]] in [[Berlin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.facebook.com/OffenerBrief|title=Causa Guttenberg - Offener Brief von Doktoranden an die Bundeskanzlerin|date=17 March 2011|publisher=Facebook|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> On 20 March 2011 the [[Zurich]] weekly [[Neue Zürcher Zeitung|NZZ]] published extracts of an apology Guttenberg had sent to Klara Obermüller for not quoting her in his dissertation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aargauerzeitung.ch/schweiz/guttenberg-entschuldigt-sich-bei-nzz-autorin-106114663|title=Guttenberg entschuldigt sich bei NZZ-Autorin|date=20 March 2011|publisher=Aargauer Zeitung|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/8393924/Karl-Theodor-zu-Guttenberg-apologises-to-Swiss-journalist-over-plagiarism-row.html|title=Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg apologises to Swiss journalist over plagiarism row|date=20 March 2011|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref>
===Commission report and response=== On 7 April 2011, the Commission of Professional Self Regulation in Science sent its report of preliminary findings to Guttenberg asking for his response by 26 April 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/076-072-guttenberg.pdf|title=Weitere Schritte der Universität Bayreuth im Fall zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|date=2011-04-12|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="Spiegel Online">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,756082,00.html|title=Guttenbergs Anwalt attackiert Uni Bayreuth|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-04-11|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref>
On 9 April 2011, there was a first leak of the commission's initial findings to the press, in which Guttenberg was accused of deliberate deception<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/plagiatsaffaere-um-doktorarbeit-gutachten-guttenberg-hat-absichtlich-abgeschrieben-1.1083118|title=Gutachten: Guttenberg hat absichtlich abgeschrieben|language=German|publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-04-08|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> Guttenberg's lawyer sharply criticized the commission's leaks as an unfair "prejudgment"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-guttenberg-anwalt-keilt-gegen-universitaet-bayreuth_aid_616988.html|title=Guttenberg-Anwalt keilt gegen Universität Bayreuth|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2011-04-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="Guttenbergs Anwalt spricht von Vorverurteilung">{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/artikel/S32372/plagiatsaffaere-guttenbergs-anwalt-spricht-von-vorverurteilung-30333737.html|title=Guttenbergs Anwalt spricht von "Vorverurteilung"|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|date=2011-04-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-04/guttenberg-anwalt-universitaet-bayreuth|title=Guttenbergs Anwalt greift Uni Bayreuth an|language=German|publisher=Zeit Onlie|date=2011-04-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> of his client given that the press reports were published both before the end of the investigation and before the 26 April deadline Guttenberg had been given by the university to respond to the commission's report before its public release.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/076-072-guttenberg.pdf|title=Weitere Schritte der Universität Bayreuth im Fall zu Guttenberg|date=12 April 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|language=German|accessdate=16 July 2013}}</ref> His lawyer also pointed out that the leaks were a violation of Guttenberg's [[personal rights]].<ref name="Spiegel Online"/> Critics accused Guttenberg of trying to prevent the public release of the commission's final report,<ref name=SDZ1/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/plagiatsaffaere-um-doktorarbeit-gutachten-guttenberg-hat-absichtlich-abgeschrieben-1.1083118|title=Gutachten: Guttenberg hat absichtlich abgeschrieben|language=German|publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-04-08|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref><ref name="Uni Bayreuth darf Guttenberg-Gutachten veröffentlichen|language=German">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/0,1518,756858,00.html|title=Uni Bayreuth darf Guttenberg-Gutachten veröffentlichen|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-04-13|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref> an allegation that he rejected.<ref name="Zeit Online">{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-04/guttenberg-doktorarbeit-untersuchungsergebnisse|title=Guttenberg stimmt Veröffentlichung des Uni-Berichts zu|language=German|publisher=Zeit Online|date=2011-04-13|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="Guttenberg lässt Gutachten veröffentlichen">{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-guttenberg-laesst-gutachten-veroeffentlichen_aid_618217.html|title=Guttenberg lässt Gutachten veröffentlichen|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2011-04-13|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> Several representatives from universities and science demanded the release of the commission's report due to public interest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.t-online.de/nachrichten/deutschland/parteien/id_45684104/plagiat-affaere-wissenschaftler-fordern-guttenberg-bericht-zu-veroeffentlichen.html|title=Wissenschaftler: Guttenberg-Bericht veröffentlichen|date=12 April 2011|publisher=T-Online|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> A spokesman of the university rejected the lawyer's charges and stated that there had been no official report accusing Guttenberg of deliberate deception.<ref name="Guttenbergs Anwalt spricht von Vorverurteilung" /> The spokesman of chancellor Merkel declared on 11 April 2011 that she was expecting full clarification of the matter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/plagiatsaffaere-merkel-verlangt-von-guttenberg-aufklaerung-a-756280.html|title=Plagiatsaffäre: Merkel verlangt von Guttenberg Aufklärung|date=11 April 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.n-tv.de/politik/Merkel-fordert-Aufklaerung-article3074641.html|title=Guttenbergs Plagiatsaffäre: Merkel fordert Aufklärung|date=11 April 2011|publisher=n-tv|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg's lawyers declared on 13 April 2011 that he was still standing by his commitment of full cooperation but that he was opposed to leaks to the press, which violated proper proceedings and caused prejudgment. Guttenberg had no objection against publishing the commission's report after end of proceedings, the lawyers said.<ref name="Uni Bayreuth darf Guttenberg-Gutachten veröffentlichen|language=German" /><ref name="Zeit Online"/><ref name="Guttenberg lässt Gutachten veröffentlichen" /> The same day it was reported that the Bundestag would not press charges against Guttenberg.<ref name=SDZ1>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/plagiatsaffaere-bundestag-verzichtet-auf-strafantrag-gegen-guttenberg-1.1084537|title=Bundestag verzichtet auf Strafantrag gegen Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-04-13|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref>
A few days later media published extracts from Guttenberg's initial response to the commission. Guttenberg denied any deliberate plagiarism. He described the working-method during the several years of his dissertation as often working in short periods and using various different data carriers. This led to his losing track of the PhD dissertation, Guttenberg stated.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/stellungnahme-fuer-uni-bayreuth-guttenberg-bestreitet-plagiatsvorwurf-a-757485.html|title=Stellungnahme für Uni Bayreuth: Guttenberg bestreitet Plagiatsvorwurf|date=16 April 2011|publisher=SPIEGEL ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/2.1673/guttenberg-bestreitet-taeuschung-habe-die-uebersicht-verloren-1625834.html|title=Habe die Übersicht verloren|date=17 April 2011|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg sent his response to the commission's draft report on 26 April 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wz-newsline.de/home/politik/inland/guttenberg-nimmt-zu-plagiatsvorwuerfen-stellung-1.643351|title=Guttenberg nimmt zu Plagiatsvorwürfen Stellung|language=German|publisher=Westdeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-04-27|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/weitere-meldungen/doktorarbeit-guttenberg-gibt-stellungnahme-an-uni-bayreuth-ab_aid_621803.html|title=Doktorarbeit: Guttenberg gibt Stellungnahme an Uni Bayreuth ab|date=27 April 2011|publisher=FOCUS Online|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> In the following days media again published extracts of his response.<ref name="Guttenberg spricht von Missverständnis" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-05/guttenberg-missverstaendnis-doktorarbeit|title=Guttenberg hält Täuschungsvorwurf für "Missverständnis"|date=1 May 2011|publisher=ZEIT ONLINE|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> On 10 May 2011 media reported that one author, whose work was copied, filed a complaint against Guttenberg with the district attorney's office in Hof.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13363867/Plagiatsopfer-stellt-Strafantrag-gegen-Guttenberg.html|title=Plagiatsopfer stellt Strafantrag gegen Guttenberg|date=10 May 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref>
==Report of Commission of Professional Self Regulation in Science== [[File:Campus-bayreuth-1.jpg|thumb|180px|University of Bayreuth]] After an announcement on 6 May 2011,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/091-089-guttenberg.pdf|title=Fall zu Guttenberg: Kommission legt ihren Abschlussbericht vor|date=6 May 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> already citing the conclusions,<ref name="spiegel.de">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/0,1518,761150,00.html|title=Guttenberg hat sich immer wieder die Autorschaft angemaßt|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-05-06|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name=" University says ex-defense minister 'deliberately cheated' on thesis">{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.de/university-says-ex-defense-minister-deliberately-cheated-on-thesis/a-15056863-1|title=University says ex-defense minister 'deliberately cheated' on thesis|date=6 May 2011|publisher=Deutsche Welle|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> the university released the report to the public on 11 May 2011.<ref name="spiegel.de"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Bericht_der_Kommission_m__Anlagen_10_5_2011_.pdf|title=Bericht an die Hochschulleitung der Universität Bayreuth|language=German|publisher=University of Bayreuth|date=2011-05-05|accessdate=2012-12-18}}</ref> According to that document, he had "grossly violated standard research practices and in so doing deliberately deceived"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/07/world/europe/07briefs-Germany.html|title=Germany: Ex-Minister’s Plagiarism Was Deliberate, University Says|date=6 May 2011|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> and it further stated that it was "obvious that plagiarism was involved".<ref name="bbc6May2011">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-13310042|title=Germany's Guttenberg 'deliberately' plagiarised|publisher=BBC News|date=2011-05-06|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref>
===Preliminaries=== The report started with the elaboration of the commission's historical background,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=3|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> its internal duties within the Bayreuth University, also in relation to other committees like the university's promotion commission.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=4|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> These included institutional enhancements, the evaluation of academic misconduct corresponding to standards of scientific community.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=5|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The report then defined the criteria of academic misconduct: deliberately or grossly negligent use of “Falschangaben” (misrepresentations), the violation of other's intellectual property, and the obstruction of research. “Falschangaben” were defined as the fabrication or distortion of data and the “obstruction of research” was defined as unauthorized use of material with arrogation of its authorship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=6|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The commission comprised as regular members [[Wiebke Putz-Osterloh]], [[Nuri Aksel]], [[Paul Rösch]], [[Stephan Rixen]] as chairman, and [[Diethelm Klippel]] as a consulting member – all from the University of Bayreuth.<ref name="report p. 7">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=7|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> On 8 March 2011 [[Wolfgang Löwer]], professor of law at University of Bonn, and [[Jürgen Mittelstraß]], professor of philosophy at University of Konstanz joined the commission as consulting members.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=9|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The report listed four commission's meeting on Guttenberg's thesis: 16 February 2011, 8 and 23 March 2011, and the final meeting on 7 April 2011. The hearings of the thesis’ supervisors were on 23 March 2011.<ref name="report p. 7" /> Then the report specified the used material including its communications with Guttenberg himself.<ref name="Universität Bayreuth"/>
===Commission’s findings=== The commission reported missing citations and violations of the academic rules of citations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=13|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> It reported numerous verbatim forms of plagiarism and plagiarism with regard to content<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=14|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13365134/Uni-Bayreuth-weist-Guttenbergs-Beteuerungen-zurueck.html|title=Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück|date=11 May 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> where the use of other authors’ material was not clearly expressed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=15|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The commission exemplified this in detail on the basis of six Parliamentary Research Service (PRS) papers and listed the passages Guttenberg had used in his thesis, including all text modifications and extensions. Two of the PRS papers lacked any citation and four PRS papers were cited insufficiently,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|pages=15–20|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> leading to misconceptions about the initial authorship of the passages.<ref name="report p. 20">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=20|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The commission judged this as deception and described a pattern of creation (werkprägendes Bearbeitungsmuster).<ref name="Universität Bayreuth gibt Guttenberg alle Schuld">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13366148/Universitaet-Bayreuth-gibt-Guttenberg-alle-Schuld.html|title=Universität Bayreuth gibt Guttenberg alle Schuld|date=11 May 2011|publisher=DIE WELT|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> As for Guttenberg, the commission concluded on intentional actions and deliberate deception due to the numbers of violations of academic rules of citations.<ref name="report p. 20" /> Both the use of verbatim text elements and the use with marginal text changes lacking proper citation or listing cited sources only in bibliography were evaluated as attempts to cover up.<ref name="report p. 21">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=21|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> The commission saw no indications that the thesis had been written by a ghost-writer.<ref name="Universität Bayreuth gibt Guttenberg alle Schuld" /><ref name="report p. 26">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=26|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
Contrary to previous expectations,<ref name=" University says ex-defense minister 'deliberately cheated' on thesis" /> the commission denied any responsibility of the thesis supervisors<ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /><ref name="report p. 26"/> due to a lack of semantic or other indicators for plagiarism<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=28|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> and Guttenberg's “exceedingly convincing” oral PhD exam ("rigorosum").<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=30|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Only the supervisors’ omission to ask for the PRS papers cited in the bibliography and the grading with “summa cum laude” was criticized by the commission.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=29|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref>
===Guttenberg’s statement=== In his final response, Guttenberg once again denied that he had deliberately deceived the university and instead blamed severe “errors in workmanship” for the grave deficiencies in his doctoral thesis.<ref name="Guttenberg spricht von Missverständnis">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,759910,00.html|title=Guttenberg spricht von Missverständnis|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-04-30|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="DerWesten.de">{{cite web|url=https://www.derwesten.de/nachrichten/politik/Guttenberg-erklaert-Plagiat-mit-Mehrfachbelastung-Uni-legt-Abschlussbericht-vor-id4635168.html|title=Guttenberg erklärt Plagiat mit Mehrfachbelastung - Uni legt Abschlussbericht vor|language=German|publisher=DerWesten.de|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="Handelsblatt">{{cite web|url=https://www.handelsblatt.com/politik/deutschland/uni-bericht-guttenberg-erklaert-plagiat-mit-dauerstress/4160418.html|title=Guttenberg erklärt Plagiat mit Dauerstress|language=German|publisher=Handelsblatt|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2012-02-28}}</ref> He described a high burden of professional commitments as a result of new political responsibilities<ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /><ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /> during the years of his dissertation, which led to an ad-hoc and sometimes chaotic working-method<ref name="Handelsblatt"/><ref name="report p. 23">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=23|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> with long intervals between working periods.<ref name="report p. 24">{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|page=24|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref> Guttenberg reported on diverse collections of material such as books, loose sheets of papers, more than 80 data carriers, and several laptops spread across several domiciles,<ref name="report p. 23" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/politik/inland/2.1673/plagiatsaffaere-guttenberg-nicht-fahrlaessig-sondern-vorsaetzlich-1643270.html|title=Nicht fahrlässig, sondern vorsätzlich|date=11 May 2011|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> used for his thesis. This led to an overburdening by the thesis, which further increased during the years, Guttenberg described.<ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /> Family expectations, namely that a started task had to be finished,<ref name="DerWesten.de"/><ref name="report p. 24" /> his intention to not disappoint his supervisor,<ref name="report p. 24" /><ref name="Guttenberg ist die Arbeit über den Kopf gewachsen">{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/abschlussbericht-zur-plagiatsaffaere-guttenberg-ist-die-arbeit-ueber-den-kopf-gewachsen-1.1095827|title=Guttenberg ist die Arbeit "über den Kopf gewachsen"|date=11 May 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref> and his unwillingness to admit weakness,<ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /><ref name="report p. 24" /> hindered him to quit the dissertation, Guttenberg explained. The commission however, based on the view, that Guttenberg had continued his dissertation despite the feeling of being overburdened, denied negligence and concluded on intention.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uni-bayreuth.de/presse/Aktuelle-Infos/2011/Ablauf_15_03_2011.pdf|title=Dokumentation Fall Guttenberg Ablauf|date=15 March 2011|publisher=Universität Bayreuth|pages=24–25|language=German|accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/panorama/vermischtes/guttenbergs-doktorarbeit-eine-grosse-schlamperei-in-folge-von-dauerstress_aid_626306.html|title=Guttenbergs Doktorarbeit: "Eine große Schlamperei in Folge von Dauerstress"|date=11 May 2011|publisher=FOCUS Online|language=German|accessdate=16 January 2014}}</ref>
==Reactions== ===Critic of Walter Schmitt-Glaeser=== The University of Bayreuth's handling of the matter was sharply criticized by its former Vice-President and law professor [[Walter Schmitt-Glaeser]], who, while agreeing that revoking the doctoral degree was justified, described the additional measures taken by the institution as an attempt at character assassination ("Treibjagd").<ref name="Über die Ohnmacht des Gejagten">{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/politik/inland/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg/plagiats-affaere-offener-brief-von-walter-schmitt-glaeser-17816744.bild.html|title=Über die Ohnmacht des Gejagten|language=German|publisher=Bild.de|date=2011-05-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> As any affiliation of Guttenberg to the university was severed by the withdrawal of his title, the university therefore lacked legal standing for any further investigation,<ref name="Bayreuth-Professor rügt Treibjagd auf Guttenberg">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13362187/Bayreuth-Professor-ruegt-Treibjagd-auf-Guttenberg.html|title=Bayreuth-Professor rügt "Treibjagd" auf Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2011-05-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name=" Ex-Uni-Präsident spricht von Treibjagd gegen Guttenberg">{{cite web|url=http://www.augsburger-allgemeine.de/politik/Ex-Uni-Praesident-spricht-von-Treibjagd-gegen-Guttenberg-id15027166.html|title=Ex-Uni-Präsident spricht von "Treibjagd" gegen Guttenberg|date=10 May 2011|publisher=Augsburger Allgemeine|language=German|accessdate=23 January 2014}}</ref> Schmitt-Glaeser argued. The leaking of information from the commission's confidential meetings to the press – according to Schmitt-Glaeser most-likely done by its members – he called “outrageous” and “more than embarrassing”.
For Schmitt-Glaeser especially the part of the report looking into a possible deception by Guttenberg should not have been published. Also, according to Schmitt-Glaeser, the fact that Guttenberg had to agree to the report's publication due to massive public pressure, including from University of Bayreuth, cast a shadow of suspicion on the entire proceedings.<ref name="Über die Ohnmacht des Gejagten" /> The professor, former president (CSU) of the [[Bavarian senate]], also criticized the lack of conclusive evidence to prove the university's assertion that there was "deliberate deception" on the part of Guttenberg,<ref name="Bild.de">{{cite web|url=http://www.bild.de/politik/inland/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg/plagiats-affaere-was-jetzt-passiert-ist-eine-treibjagd-17814204.bild.html|title=Was jetzt passiert, ist eine Treibjagd|language=German|publisher=Bild.de|date=2011-05-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> Schmitt-Glaeser referred to the multiple instances of minor text changes – which the commission viewed as indicators of cheating – as a typical procedure with a text considered by an author as his own work.<ref name="Über die Ohnmacht des Gejagten" /> With the proceedings the university denied any solicitousness for its former student Guttenberg<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/guttenberg-affaere-walter-schmitt-glaeser-kritisiert-uni-bayreuth-1683247.html|title=Walter Schmitt-Glaeser kritisiert Uni Bayreuth|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2011-05-10|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref> and damaged his social existence,<ref name=" Ex-Uni-Präsident spricht von Treibjagd gegen Guttenberg" /> the professor criticized. From the judicial proceeding on this case he expected a result solely based on facts without regard to the person concerned.<ref name="Über die Ohnmacht des Gejagten" /> In an interview, Schmitt-Glaeser described the university's intention as an attempt to “drag Guttenberg in front of a [[tribunal]] and find him guilty”.<ref name="Bild.de"/> In the professor's conviction, knowing Guttenberg personally, he had not committed intentional cheating.<ref name="Bayreuth-Professor rügt Treibjagd auf Guttenberg" />
===Disputed neutrality=== Others{{Who|date=December 2016}} criticized the commission's final report for not decrying the university's own lack of [[due diligence]]<ref name="Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück" /> in the matter and noted that the university had first awarded Guttenberg's degree with the highest possible distinction ("summa cum laude").<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dradio.de/dlf/sendungen/interview_dlf/1455639/|title=War das die Landesblindenanstalt?|language=German|publisher=Deutschlandfunk|date=2011-05-11|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref name="Guttenberg rührt seine Richter">{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/finaler-bericht-der-uni-bayreuth-guttenberg-ruehrt-seine-richter-1683658.html|title=Guttenberg rührt seine Richter|date=11 May 2011|publisher=stern.de|language=German|accessdate=23 January 2014}}</ref> Furthermore, the commission's neutrality was disputed as the University of Bayreuth was party to the proceedings. Among these critics was Thomas Goppel (CSU), former Bavarian Minister of Education, who viewed the report as an attempt by the university to downplay its own responsibility and acquit itself.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dradio.de/dlf/sendungen/interview_dlf/1455170/|title=Goppel: Guttenbergs Politikkarriere "im Prinzip vorbei"|date=11 May 2011|publisher=Deutschlandfunk|language=German|accessdate=23 January 2014}}</ref> Others complained about the University's lack of control provisions.<ref name="Universität Bayreuth gibt Guttenberg alle Schuld" />
===Volker Rieble=== Professor Volker Rieble approved the report of the University but saw the case as an expression of the public desire for “ritual punishment”. Rieble decried the widespread practice of academic publications being written by assistants but published by professors as much worse for academia than any plagiarism.<ref name="Guttenberg rührt seine Richter" />
===Günther Beckstein=== [[Günther Beckstein]], former [[Minister-President]] of Bavaria, referred to Guttenberg by saying that everyone deserves a second chance, after some period of time.<ref name="Universität Bayreuth gibt Guttenberg alle Schuld" />
==August 2011== In August 2011, the authors of Guttenplag Wiki, which triggered similar initiatives on [[VroniPlag Wiki]], were accused of running a partisan campaign after it emerged that the founder of VroniPlag was a member of the opposition [[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD party]].<ref name="Im Schwarm" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.badische-zeitung.de/deutschland-1/plagiatsjaeger-enttarnt-vorwurf-der-parteilichkeit--48254663.html|title=Plagiatsjäger enttarnt – Vorwurf der Parteilichkeit|language=German|publisher=Badische Zeitung|date=2011-08-05|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13529200/VroniPlag-Gruender-sichert-sich-Namensrechte.html|title=VroniPlag-Gründer sichert sich Namensrechte|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2011-08-05|accessdate=2011-09-07}}</ref>
==Cessation of proceedings== In November 2011 the attorney's office in Hof dropped<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052970204630904577058002872268724|title=Germany Drops Criminal Probe of zu Guttenberg|date=24 November 2011|publisher=THE WALL STREET JOURNAL|accessdate=13 February 2014}}</ref> the charges against Guttenberg after having found 23 relevant copyright violations with only minor economic damage.<ref name="attHof">{{cite web|url=http://www.justiz.bayern.de/sta/sta/ho/presse/archiv/2011/03268/index.php|title=Ermittlungsverfahren Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Staatsanwaltschaft Hof|date=2011-11-23|accessdate=2012-02-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/ermittlungen-in-plagiatsaffaere-eingestellt-guttenberg-kommt-glimpflich-davon-1.1197275|title=Guttenberg kommt glimpflich davon|date=23 November 2011|publisher=Süddeutsche.de|language=German|accessdate=13 February 2014}}</ref> This decision was criticized for being biased toward economic criteria.<ref name="Hof" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/guttenberg-opfer-er-hat-getaeuscht-ohne-zu-bereuen-a-799515.html|title=Guttenberg-Opfer: "Er hat getäuscht, ohne zu bereuen"|language=German|publisher=Spiegel online|date=2011-11-23|accessdate=2012-12-20}}</ref> The court approved this arrangement after Guttenberg had agreed to make a donation of 20,000 Euro to a German charitable foundation.<ref name="attHof" /><ref name="Hof">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-staatsanwaltschaft-stellt-ermittlungen-gegen-guttenberg-ein-a-799457.html|title=Staatsanwaltschaft stellt Ermittlungen gegen Guttenberg ein|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-11-23|accessdate=2012-12-21}}</ref>
The attorney's office saw no indications that Guttenberg had intentionally used other authors’ texts within his thesis without proper attribution and judged his explanation of losing track of sources as “comprehensible and irrefutable”.<ref name="Spiegel 2011-12">{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/0,1518,801533,00.html|title=Staatsanwaltschaft geht nicht von Täuschungsabsicht aus|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-12-04|accessdate=2012-02-28}}</ref><ref name="KR">{{cite web|url=http://www.rundschau-online.de/html/artikel/1322581266424.shtml|title=Staatsanwalt entlastet zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Kölnische Rundschau|date=2011-12-04|accessdate=2012-02-28}}</ref> Contrary to University of Bayreuth, which had accused Guttenberg of deliberate deception, the prosecution concluded that Guttenberg had made the thesis’ errors only with contingent intent (dolus eventualis).<ref name="Welt111204">{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13749960/Guttenberg-soll-nicht-absichtlich-getaeuscht-haben.html|title=Guttenberg soll nicht absichtlich getäuscht haben|language=German|publisher=Die Welt|date=2011-12-11|accessdate=2012-12-18}}</ref> The attorney's office also stated that there was no criminal abuse of his PhD title nor fraud or breach of trust related to PRS papers either.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://seattletimes.com/html/nationworld/2016830567_apeugermanyministerplagiarism.html|title=Prosecutors drop case against German ex-minister|date=23 November 2011|accessdate=13 February 2014}}</ref>
